levers.label: Avoid
levers.description: Passenger and freight transport demand reduction. [More info](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kO_jI-8VEQi-XYh6ZcMNFZSGf_RDBC0r/view?usp=sharing)

valueDescriptions.1: **Level 1**. Between 2024 and 2050, demand for passenger transport grows six-fold. Freight demand grows three-fold.
valueDescriptions.2: **Level 2**. Passenger demand in 2050 is 10% lower than in Level 1. Freight demand is 5% percent lower.
valueDescriptions.3: **Level 3**. Passenger demand in 2050 is 20% lower than in Level 1. Freight demand is 10% percent lower.
valueDescriptions.4: **Level 4**. Passenger demand in 2050 is 30% lower than in Level 1, growing four-fold between 2024 and 2050. Freight demand is 15% percent lower than in Level 1.

levers.label: Shift
levers.description: Modal shift, vehicle utilisation rate increase, vehicle occupancy increase. [More info](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KIBk6Cn8-XP2E6ZNqcY3meghpYvVNqrA/view?usp=sharing)

valueDescriptions.1: **Level 1**. In 2050, modal profiles are the same as in 2024. Private transport meets 75% of passenger demand. Road vehicles meet 85% of freight demand, with the rest met by rail. Vehicle occupancy and vehicle utilisation rates stay at their 2024 levels.
valueDescriptions.2: **Level 2**. By 2050, public and active transport meet 40% of passenger demand. Rail meets 25% of freight demand. Vehicle occupancy and vehicle utilisation rates increase slightly until 2050.
valueDescriptions.3: **Level 3**. By 2050, public and active transport meet 50% of passenger demand. Rail meets 40% of freight demand. Vehicle occupancy and vehicle utilisation rates increase moderately until 2050.
valueDescriptions.4: **Level 4**. By 2050, public and active transport meet 60% of passenger demand. Rail meets 50% of freight demand. Vehicle occupancy and vehicle utilisation rates increase substantially until 2050.

levers.label: Improve
levers.description: Transport technology switch away from emitting vehicles. [More info](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KCqVBt3Nay5Q0uLXn10gO48saEuuC9dJ/view?usp=sharing)

valueDescriptions.1: **Level 1**. No constraint on vehicle point-of-use emissions.
valueDescriptions.2: **Level 2**. Vehicle point-of-use emissions in 2050 are one-third lower than in Level 1.
valueDescriptions.3: **Level 3**. Vehicle point-of-use emissions in 2050 are two-thirds lower than in Level 1.
valueDescriptions.4: **Level 4**. The vehicle fleet has zero point-of-use emissions by 2050.

levers.label: Transform
levers.description: Decarbonisation of the power sector and fuel blending. [More info](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1T0sX78iissYa7XJhVF0n-AfUUwsPM6Kr/view?usp=sharing)

valueDescriptions.1: **Level 1**. No constraint on power sector emissions. Fuels do not contain biofuels.
valueDescriptions.2: **Level 2**. Power sector emissions in 2050 are one-third lower than in Level 1. Fuel blends contain one-sixth biofuels.
valueDescriptions.3: **Level 3**. Power sector emissions in 2050 are two-thirds lower than in Level 1. Fuel blends contain one-third biofuels.
valueDescriptions.4: **Level 4**. The power sector reaches zero emissions by 2050. Biofuels make up half of fuel blends.

levers.label: Costs
levers.description: Steeper cost reductions for developing technologies. [More info](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10AmbAQpY2eS0JdMsu_-2thA0b0qM4lN-/view?usp=sharing)

valueDescriptions.1: **Level 1**. Capital and fixed costs of vehicles on the learning curve fall by up to 25% between 2024 and 2050.
valueDescriptions.2: **Level 2**.  Capital and fixed costs of vehicles on the learning curve fall by up to 45% between 2024 and 2050.
valueDescriptions.3: **Level 3**. Capital and fixed costs of vehicles on the learning curve fall by up to 50% between 2024 and 2050.
valueDescriptions.4: **Level 4**. Capital and fixed costs of vehicles on the learning curve fall by up to 60% between 2024 and 2050.
